flags.title: User-Contributed Project
flags.text: This project guide is not managed by MAKE staff.

guide.introduction: This project will take about 8 hours. It doesn't need to be done all in one sitting. Enjoy and take your time.
guide.introduction_rendered:
This project will take about 8 hours. It doesn't need to be done all in one sitting. Enjoy and take your time.

Relevant parts
  • 8oz PVC Cement Red Hot Low Voc
  • Pressure Gauge 0-100 PSI
  • Electronic Sprinkler Valve
  • 9V Battery (2)
  • Switch
  • Wire
  • Bike Tire Valve
  • Marshmallows
  • Altoids Box
  • PVC Tape
  • PB110 1/2" x 1/4" Brass Pipe Bushing
  • PB101 1/4" Brass Pipe Tee
  • PB113 1/4" Close Brass Pipe Nipple
  • PVC 1 1/2" EL 90D EL (4)
  • PVC 3/4" EL 90D EL
  • PVC 1" x 1" x 3/4" Tee
  • PVC 3/4" x 3/4" Tee (2)
  • PVC 1-1/2" x 1 1/2 x 1" Tee (2)
  • PVC 1 1/2" x 1 1/2" x 1 1/2" Tee
  • PVC 1-1/2" Cross
  • PVC 3/4" Running Trap (2)
  • PVC 1" Male Adapter (2)
  • PVC 1" x 3/4" Bushing (2)
  • PVC 1-1/2" x 1" Bushing
  • PVC 3/4" x 1/2" Bushing
  • PVC Marshmallow Barrell
  • PVC 1 1/2" x 12" (2)
  • PVC 1 1/2" x 10"
  • PVC 1 1/2" x 6 1/2"
  • PVC 1 1/2" x 2 1/2" (4)
  • PVC 1 1/2" x 3 7/8" (1)
  • PVC 3/4" x 1 1/2" (3)
  • PVC 1" x 2 1/2" (1)
  • PVC 1" x 2" (1)
Tools
  • Hack saw

parts.text: 8oz PVC Cement Red Hot Low Voc

lines.text: Parts
lines.text_raw: Parts

lines.text: Make sure you have everything you need.
lines.text_raw: Make sure you have everything you need.

lines.text: Cut pieces are not pictured. You will cut these yourself.
lines.text_raw: Cut pieces are not pictured. You will cut these yourself.

lines.text: PVC pipe joints need to be twisted when gluing them together. It makes a better seal. However, there are a few spots where twisting can't be done.
lines.text_raw: PVC pipe joints need to be twisted when gluing them together. It makes a better seal. However, there are a few spots where twisting can't be done.

lines.text: Cut PVC as directed.
lines.text_raw: Cut PVC as directed.

lines.text: 1 - 1 1/2" x 10"
1 - 1" x 2 1/2"
1 - 1" x 2"
3 - 3/4" x 1 1/2"
Lay out pieces to make sure you have everything.
lines.text_raw: Lay out pieces to make sure you have everything.

lines.text: Dry-fitting the entire project is a great idea. Some pieces may need to be sawed down to fit correctly. Lining up the handle can be tricky.
lines.text_raw: Dry-fitting the entire project is a great idea. Some pieces may need to be sawed down to fit correctly. Lining up the handle can be tricky.

lines.text: Draw guide marks. These will help you know when you've pushed the pipe in far enough, and keep it level.
lines.text_raw: Draw guide marks. These will help you know when you've pushed the pipe in far enough, and keep it level.

lines.text: Picture 2 shows an example of guide marks.
lines.text_raw: Picture 2 shows an example of guide marks.

lines.text: We will be starting with the bottom and working upwards.
lines.text_raw: We will be starting with the bottom and working upwards.

lines.text: Remember: PVC glue dries VERY fast.
lines.text_raw: Remember: PVC glue dries VERY fast.

lines.text: You will spread PVC glue around the short pieces and inside the shaped pieces.
lines.text_raw: You will spread PVC glue around the short pieces and inside the shaped pieces.

lines.text: Push and twist together. Make VERY sure that they are all level. If they are not level the rest of the pieces will not fit.
lines.text_raw: Push and twist together. Make VERY sure that they are all level. If they are not level the rest of the pieces will not fit.

lines.text: Quickly after/while inserting the pieces we laid it flat on the table and pushed it flat. This makes sure the whole base is level.
lines.text_raw: Quickly after/while inserting the pieces we laid it flat on the table and pushed it flat. This makes sure the whole base is level.

lines.text: Using the same method -
lines.text_raw: Using the same method -

lines.text: 1 1/2" x 12" one on each side.
lines.text_raw: 1 1/2" x 12" one on each side.

lines.text: 1 1/2" x 6 1/2" in the center.
lines.text_raw: 1 1/2" x 6 1/2" in the center.

lines.text: Layout (Picture 1)
lines.text_raw: Layout (Picture 1)

lines.text: Glue the two pieces shown. (Pictures 2 and 3)
lines.text_raw: Glue the two pieces shown. (Pictures 2 and 3)

lines.text: Layout
lines.text_raw: Layout

lines.text: Glue a piece 1 1/2" x 10" into the two T pieces. Set aside.
lines.text_raw: Glue a piece 1 1/2" x 10" into the two T pieces. Set aside.

lines.text: Glue together part of the handle. (Picture 1)
lines.text_raw: Glue together part of the handle. (Picture 1)

lines.text: Glue the two together.
lines.text_raw: Glue the two together.

lines.text: Glue the whole piece into the center piece.
lines.text_raw: Glue the whole piece into the center piece.

lines.text: Layout
lines.text_raw: Layout

lines.text: Glue together as shown in picture 2.
lines.text_raw: Glue together as shown in picture 2.

lines.text: Glue whole piece into main piece.
lines.text_raw: Glue whole piece into main piece.

lines.text: Layout
lines.text_raw: Layout

lines.text: Glue bushing & small piece into top of X piece. (Picture 2)
lines.text_raw: Glue bushing & small piece into top of X piece. (Picture 2)

lines.text: Glue the next handle. (Picture 3)
lines.text_raw: Glue the next handle. (Picture 3)

lines.text: Glue small piece into small elbow. (Picture 1)
lines.text_raw: Glue small piece into small elbow. (Picture 1)

lines.text: Glue elbow into end of handle. (Picture 2)
lines.text_raw: Glue elbow into end of handle. (Picture 2)

lines.text: Glue T piece into both small pieces. (Picture 3)
lines.text_raw: Glue T piece into both small pieces. (Picture 3)

lines.text: Glue small piece into end of T (Picture 1).
lines.text_raw: Glue small piece into end of T (Picture 1).

lines.text: Layout
lines.text_raw: Layout

lines.text: Glue pieces as shown (Picture 2).
lines.text_raw: Glue pieces as shown (Picture 2).

lines.text: Use PVC tape for all screw fittings.
lines.text_raw: Use PVC tape for all screw fittings.

lines.text: Other end.
lines.text_raw: Other end.

lines.text: Glue piece into PVC.
lines.text_raw: Glue piece into PVC.

lines.text: Screw pieces in as shown. (Pictures 2 & 3)
lines.text_raw: Screw pieces in as shown. (Pictures 2 & 3)

lines.text: Remember to use PVC tape.
lines.text_raw: Remember to use PVC tape.

lines.text: Continue with end assembly.
lines.text_raw: Continue with end assembly.

lines.text: Before and after paint
lines.text_raw: Before and after paint

lines.text: Put a 12" piece of PVC into the top. This is where the marshmallows will be loaded and fired.
lines.text_raw: Put a 12" piece of PVC into the top. This is where the marshmallows will be loaded and fired.

lines.text: You will need to solder wires from the sprinkler valve, switches and extra wire to battery pack. Hide battery in Altoids can.
lines.text_raw: You will need to solder wires from the sprinkler valve, switches and extra wire to battery pack. Hide battery in Altoids can.

lines.text: One switch is your safety, the other is the firing switch.
lines.text_raw: One switch is your safety, the other is the firing switch.

lines.text: Load marshmallow. Pump with bike pump to 30 PSI. Flip your safety off and fire. The marshmallows will go far, so make sure you have a safe area to shoot them.
lines.text_raw: Load marshmallow. Pump with bike pump to 30 PSI. Flip your safety off and fire. The marshmallows will go far, so make sure you have a safe area to shoot them.

lines.text: WARNING: Only pump the air cannon to 30PSI. Any more could result in damage to cannon or yourself.
lines.text_raw: WARNING: Only pump the air cannon to 30PSI. Any more could result in damage to cannon or yourself.

guide.summary: These are complete directions on how to put together the Extreme Marshmallow Cannon. Some steps will require 2 people.
guide.title: Extreme Marshmallow Cannon
